title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits against their rivals.
Starter Lucas Giolito gave up two runs over 5.2 innings, but Red Sox offensive struggles persisted.
Boston committed three errors and failed to capitalize with runners in scoring position, going 0-for-8.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Washington Commanders' Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise was injured trying to block an extra point in the second quarter and requires surgery.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March after eight years with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early, a Red Sox prospect, may start against the Athletics next week after a noteworthy MLB debut.
Early struck out 11 batters with no runs in his debut, tying a Red Sox record for most strikeouts in an MLB debut.
Manager Alex Cora is considering Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison for starting roles to manage pitching depth.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Scott Boras and Alex Bregman will decide on a contract opt-out after the 2025 season with the Red Sox.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million contract in February, with an opt-out option after 2025.
Bregman has been instrumental in mentoring Boston's young players, positively impacting his teammates and leadership role.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5, starring Steve Martin and Selena Gomez, now streaming on Hulu.
'Misery', starring Kathy Bates, available for streaming on HBO Max.
'Warfare', a film co-directed by Alex Garland, streaming on HBO Max.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots Christian Gonzalez and Keion White ruled out for Week 2 against the Dolphins due to injuries.
Gonzalez has been sidelined by a hamstring injury since late July, missing the season opener against the Raiders.
Patriots linebacker Marte Mapu and tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for the game, with potential replacements noted.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins in the absence of DC Terrell Williams.
Kuhr, in his first season as Patriots inside linebackers coach, gains play-calling experience from his time with Tennessee Titans.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel expresses confidence in Kuhr's ability to handle the defensive responsibilities effectively.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges before her trial set for October 14 in Boston.
Charges include conspiracy, wire fraud, and making false statements; she could face decades in prison and substantial fines.
Prosecutors allege Cannon-Grant and her late husband misused nonprofit donations for personal expenses, leading to her indictment in 2022.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, was arrested in Utah for the shooting of Charlie Kirk and is facing multiple felony charges.
Robinson, an electrical apprentice at Dixie Technical College, had reportedly become more political and critical of Kirk recently.
Utah Gov. Spencer Cox stated that Robinson's family reported his confession, and it is believed he acted alone in the incident.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees are competing for the top American League wild-card spot at Fenway Park this weekend.
Boston leads the season series 8-2 against New York, dominating previous matchups with strong performances from their pitchers.
Yankees rely heavily on home runs for success, hitting 249 this season and ranking high in MLB for long balls.
